website_summaries.verdict: The G29 leaves competing racing wheels in its dust due to its premium construction, realistic rumble feedback, and true-to-life driving controls.
pros: Dual-motor feedback delivers a realistic driving experience
Feels like a real race car’s wheel
Available for PC, Xbox One, and PS4
cons: No included software for PC users, so you will need to install it manually

customer_reviews.title: Solid wheel set
customer_reviews.text: So far very happy with the G29. I was debating between the Logitech or Thrustmaster file a while but pulled the trigger when the G29 was on sale. Wheel seems accurate and so far works well with Dirt Rally and Project Cars. Should be even better when I get a proper wheel stand.
customer_reviews.author: eggo34

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy until prices goes back down to normal. Don't pay the markup
customer_reviews.text: Product is excellent. Have had mine for 3 years now still works great. Writing this to call out the insane markup during a pandemic. This wheel/pedal setup should be no more than 260 bucks. PERIOD. All because iracing is on TV now you think it's ok to mark this up over 200 dollars when 1 that's not even justifiable and 2 during a time of financial crisis. Disgusting really.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very hard to use.
customer_reviews.text: I was all kinds of excited to get this as an early Christmas gift, then that all turned into disappointment once I started to use it. . . The wheel itself is very nice and made of high quality material. But the use of it was ridiculously hard. Almost imposible. I wouldn’t suggest buying the gear shift either it dosen’t even work half the time.
customer_reviews.author: Dylan Coffey

customer_reviews.title: expensive useless wheel
customer_reviews.text: Wow! What a crappy wheel! I spend almost 5 hours trying to configure it to play with Forza 7 and Horizon 3 on my Xbox X. I even tried other suggestions from youtube. Nothing works. This wheel got a mind of its own. I even set it to beginner but it just want to crash the car. The feedback and return to center is always too strong so you're basically fighting the wheel instead of driving the car.
customer_reviews.author: NYNY

customer_reviews.title: It was great, while it worked properly.
customer_reviews.text: This may have been a bad batch. Mine worked great the first day. The next day of use, the wheel started making a loud whine, loud enough to wake up my wife. It still operated but the slight burned plastic smell and whine made me return it as I play, most of the time, at night. The previous night she said couldn't tell I was using it. I can't blame the seller or product, like I said probably a bad batch. However, as quality control seems to be a problem, this has opened my eyes to another product. The Fanatec systems.
customer_reviews.author: Eric A. Rodriguez

customer_reviews.title: $600 today used, $213 new a few months ago.
customer_reviews.text: Great Wheel, I've used it for GT Sport, the feedback is great. The pedals are awesome shifter works good but could've been a little bigger ;). But why are so many dirtbags Trying to sell this G29 for $600 - $1000?
customer_reviews.author: Yensie

customer_reviews.title: Great wheel
customer_reviews.text: This is a really cool racing wheel. While I haven't used any other brands, this being my first, I can't compare it to anything else. Using it in games like F1 2016, Dirt Rally and Project cars, creates for a very solid experience with plenty of feedback. For each game I generally have to tweak the brake pedal to reach full braking power a little earlier as it is hard to fully depress the pedal. It feels nice though, but games generally seem to expect you be able to fully depress the pedal to get 100% brake and that's pretty difficult to do. Fortunately it's pretty easy to fix in each game.
customer_reviews.author: Lilfurbal

customer_reviews.title: Great pandemic gift
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my husband a month ago for his birthday and I haven’t seen him since. So it must be working well. I occasionally hear him crash so I know he’s still around and food goes missing. Works perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: Patricia Jibben

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality control from Logitech
customer_reviews.text: The pedals cable came cutted. I cannot return back the product because it is at outside of U.S. To send it back I have to pay USD70 and extra USD70 to send it to me again. Poor quality control from Logitech!
customer_reviews.author: Leonardo Sierra

customer_reviews.title: Gas pedal did not work on arrival
customer_reviews.text: So it arrived today and straight out of the box the gas pedal did not work, would not register when brake and clutch did. Thought about playing with the clutch as the gas pedal then thought I would crash my real car next time I got in it. Getting a replacement, hopefully that works well.
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: Defective wheel!!!
customer_reviews.text: STAY AWAY FROM THIS WHEEL!!! Wheel will suddenly lose center if moving the wheel too quickly during play. Absolute TRASH!! If you slowly turn the wheel as though you are going on a sunday drive to church, you'll be fine. Unfortunately I use the wheel for primarily sim rally racing and it's impossible to use. I wouldn't trust this wheel in an actual online competition. I've contacted Logitech support but I get the generic "please check our support forums for your issue". After researching my problem on the internet, it seems I'm not the only one who has this problem If I were a lawyer, I'd SUE Logitech!!!
customer_reviews.author: Enjoying Life

customer_reviews.title: Waste of Money
customer_reviews.text: We've had this wheel for only 6 months and it is now a paper weight. The tech support from LogiTech was not helpful at all after following their detailed "fixes" for the issue of the wheel no longer responding to the PC. Driver updates, OS updates in addition to a factory restore of our PC would not fix our issue of the wheel no longer being recognized by the host computer. We even tried replacing the the power supply per some LogiTech forum posts to no avail. Almost $300 lost hurts to the core when thinking about only being able to use this wheel for 3 months.
customer_reviews.author: Alexander Zaldivar

customer_reviews.title: Perhaps my expectations were too high based on the 4.3 star user rating.
customer_reviews.text: Does it work as a force feedback racing wheel with pedals? Yes it does. It just doesn't do it as well as I think a $400 retail price piece of equipment should. Even at the $200 price point that I paid, the backlash in the steering and the cogging of the gears when turning the wheel did not make for a satisfactory user experience. Definitely not worth the price Logitech is claiming this unit is worth or being sold at. Based on the reviews I assumed that I must have received a defective wheel assembly and returned it for a refund. I wasn't convinced that a replacement would be any better based on the technology used.
customer_reviews.author: Lorin M.

customer_reviews.title: Good product but bad game support
customer_reviews.text: The wheel has an exceptional build quality. Everything feels premium about the product. HoweverI had multiple driver issues. Used it on PC with a few games. On F1 2018, it kept disconnecting. Only the steering worked, all other buttons kept getting disabled after launching the game. After fiddling with the settings, reinstalling drivers and switching wheel between ps3 and ps4 mode, i got it to work. But after restarting my computer again thr same issues. Too much effort for playing the game every time. Tried it on a few other games, and it was not recognized. Worked well on couple of other games
customer_reviews.author: Techno Sid

customer_reviews.title: decent wheel/pedal combo.
customer_reviews.text: the wheel is great, feels premium. wish it was slightly larger but whatever. the pedals are really where this falls behind other wheel sets. the brake is ridiculously hard to press. in games like American Truck Simulator it's fine as i can adjust sensitivity. but trying to play forza on this thing is impossible. i can stand on the brake and still not stop before hitting a wall. it took me forever to figure out how to reverse w/ automatic transmission as i literally need to put all my weight on it to go in reverse. hopefully it gets easier to press over time otherwise i'm gonna have to mod it or return it.
customer_reviews.author: Dylan

customer_reviews.title: Decent product, would probably buy the competition instead
customer_reviews.text: PC use only: It's a good wheel. This is the first ever wheel I've bought, so initial setup took some learning, but was straightforward enough. Getting it to work properly with some games can be exceedingly frustrating, but it's hard to differentiate whether it's the game itself being the difficulty or the wheel. After buying the G29 and doing a bit more tech support googling and the like, I'd probably purchase the Thrustmaster T300 if given the choice again. Although I've been decently happy with the product, it's design does seem to be compromised where the T300 is a much more focused, quality product.
customer_reviews.author: David B.

customer_reviews.title: Great wheel
customer_reviews.text: Cannot recommend this product enough. I’ve had it for about 3 weeks now. This was my first wheel I also bought the shifter, playseat challenge, and a 3rd party shifter mount. I had a cheaper wheel stand at first, but it does not come close to having this on a real racing seat. Product works amazing and feels incredibly sturdy. The only piece that’s not perfect is the shifter itself(sold separately) feels a little cheap. If the shifter were to break in the future it would be an easy/cheap replacement
customer_reviews.author: Ryan Lemm

customer_reviews.title: On PC, plug and play right into project cars
customer_reviews.text: Mod the brake petal, seriously, mod the brake petal...in case I wasn't clear...mod the brake petal. -1 Star because I had to mod the brake petal. Otherwise it's solid. Good feedback, quite accurate, and solid feel. But that stupid piece of rubber in the brake petal. I could only get 57% travel on the brake petal without standing on it. Even without the rubber, the brake is tight. Anyway, if you have an xbox get this wheel, if you have a ps4 get the other one. If won't get a console, just pick one...but this wheel is quite solid.
customer_reviews.author: Trevor Robson

customer_reviews.title: Not so great.
customer_reviews.text: I tried many setup profiles but never could get it to work correctly. The force feedback is very strong causing much pain in both my wrist. This can be adjusted in game setting. There was something wrong with my brake pedal as it was very stiff. I had to press so hard on the pedal that it bent my rig frame that it was mounted on. The gas and clutch pedal were fine. The quality of the product was built very well. I ended up sending mine back due to my problems.
customer_reviews.author: Teresa

customer_reviews.title: Everything is great if you have a stand
customer_reviews.text: I played with this wheel for one singular 30 minute session and immediately put it away and ordered a stand. Without a proper stand the steering wheel mount works awfully, the wheel slides around while I use it and the mounting bracket actually broke. Also, the pedals slide around even though they have little rubber pieces to stop that.. Went ahead and ordered a stand (GT Omega Stand) and now I absolutely love this product. Currently putting like 3 hours a day into it and I am loving it. Going to give it 5 stars because I love the product and don't want to give is a misleading false negative review.
customer_reviews.author: Enzo Romano

customer_reviews.title: Night and day
customer_reviews.text: Coming from a $70 wheel and pedals this is night and day. I still have a PS3. this works seamlessly with F1 2014 and Driver san Francisco. It also works seamlessly with the original GRID. (Which Sony is selling for 10 bucks online!) Leather wrapped wheel, aluminum and steel construction. Fit and finish are excellent. you NEED a wheel mount with this, it produces A LOT of torque. I bought this on black Friday for 199. I personally wouldn't have paid full price for it. Not that it's not worth it, it's just a bridge too far.
customer_reviews.author: BoonDock Saint

customer_reviews.title: Its ok.
customer_reviews.text: Wheel feels kinda flimsy, but havnt had any problems with it yet. Its very adjustable and seems accurate. The shifter feels so cheesy and cheap you would think it was a toy in a cereal box. The pedals feel great but the cleats that are suppose to hold it in place work 0%. It’ll slide around like nobodies business. I can butt it up against the wall and my desk and tht gets it to stay still but it should work with just the cleats. Everything works well enough for now, i wouldnt be surprised if something broke though, a lot of this stuff just feels cheap
customer_reviews.author: Joshua Jollie

customer_reviews.title: Just ok, spend a little more
customer_reviews.text: Steering wheel mount slips on my table, your mileage my vary. I don't like the gear/notchiness of the steering and there's a dead zone in the center. The brake pedal requires way too much pressure to register 100%. I returned it and got the Thrustmaster T300 RS GT instead, which uses a belt drive for steering. Using this on my Windows 10 pc with Forza 7 and Horizon 4
customer_reviews.author: achlvnv

customer_reviews.title: Happy with the product
customer_reviews.text: I like it a lot but I have no experience with others. It feels like a very high quality set, everything looks, feels and works great. The pedals position is very strange to me, not like on my real car but you get used to it anyway. The wheels has great feedback and the materials used are really nice to touch. The only advice I can give to beginners and first time buyers is: Think about a REALLY good and stable stand/racing rig before you buy. The force applied by the whee is going to be strong. It should be installed on a strong stable surface. Have fun
customer_reviews.author: LoLa

customer_reviews.title: Nice accessory, but be careful with wires
customer_reviews.text: My son loves this steering wheel. One issue we've come across is that the wires are not replaceable. Our cat chewed one of the wires, and it can't be replaced since it is hard wired to device. Logitech doesn't do repairs for something like this, even at our expense, so we are now in search of a repair facility for the wire, or will be attempting it ourselves. Definitely something we'll consider in the future with our monster cat on the loose!
customer_reviews.author: Kelly

customer_reviews.title: Good starter wheel; you should get this if you aren't sure about other brands or the technology
customer_reviews.text: This is a fine wheel. It provides you feedback. You can tune it. It does everything you want and beyond an arcade wheel. Had run using it on sim games from Dirt Rally to iRacing. No problem at all thanks to Logitech brand backing it. Supported by all games and was easy to setup. If you do not trust Thrustmaster brand vs Logitech backing, or belt-drive vs gear-drive, go with this. If you really think you are passionate about it (which I doubt), you sure still can return this and upgrade. Pedal that came with it was a bit stiff on break thanks to the loadcell, but I just remap the clutch to break to fit my soft break taste.
customer_reviews.author: 15anthony15

customer_reviews.title: Its great
customer_reviews.text: For years I have pined over getting a elaborate racing sim set up. The more realistic the racing sim the worse it is to play on a controller. This thin is great I haven't had it long but I've used it a bunch and it still feels tight and new. I went with the logitec one for the price difference to the more high end stuff and I am not dissapointed. I do wish it had an E Brake but the shifter feels pretty good bout as solid as my subaru irl XDXD great entry level product will be fleshing out racing sims much more for years to come.
customer_reviews.author: Brian

customer_reviews.title: Logitech G29 w/ I-Racing
customer_reviews.text: Wheels operates the same as the Logitech G27, but looks different. Great force feedback. Pedals are same as G27 with the exception of the upgraded brake pedal (which makes all the difference in the world for simulation racing). I used this on the PC; only issue is that the equipment must be in PS4 mode in order for the PC to recognize it. Beyond that, best wheel on the market under $400.00 Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Jason

customer_reviews.title: Awesome wheel would give a 10 star
customer_reviews.text: Had my hopes pretty low as a caution thinking the description would be over hyped. Thankfully I was wrong! This wheel gives you a huge amount of feedback. The leather feels comfortable, and the paddles crisp. Also the pedals are very solid. I have played Nascar heat 4, forza 7, forza H2, and Dirt 4. Each has a unique feel to it. The wheel really adapts to each car as you can feel the changes i.e weight, tires, gravel, concrete. It's so strong I almost lost a pinky when I lost control once. (NOT FOR KIDS) For anyone looking for a true race simulator wheel THIS IS IT!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: michael

customer_reviews.title: Great wheel and pedals and even better customer service
customer_reviews.text: I have my Logitech wheel and pedals for 18 months with TONS of use. I love both. Recently I encountered a problem and contacted them. Their service was terrific. After an initial on-line warranty form, they contacted me with some suggested solutions. When these did not work I called them and always had a very helpful person to talk to. They quickly OK'd my issue under warranty and shipped me a new wheel. I could not have been happier. Their service was 180 degrees from the "service" my friend received on his Thrustmaster pedals which he is still trying to solve. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Terrible user experience
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely ridiculous. After installing all drivers and required software, the steering is not recognized by my pc. There isn't even a calibration method within Logitech's little software hub. First wheel and a complete disappointment and pain. Won't update to a better score if it starts working because I've been at it all day
customer_reviews.author: Paul

customer_reviews.title: Gooe Entry Level FFB Wheel
customer_reviews.text: I replaced a G27 that I wore out with the G29. I use it on a PC, primarily with iRacing. I chose this over the G92 because it has more programmable buttons. The G29 shifter is sold separately and has no buttons or D-pad anymore. Those have all been moved to the wheel, but are now so close together is it easy to hit the wrong button when you are wearing gloves. My G27 shifter works fine, the buttons on it now are just for show. Direct drive is the way to go, but this is a good FFB wheel for $225.
customer_reviews.author: S. Metzler

customer_reviews.title: Best for getting into sim racing!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to play some Asseto Corsa along with my VR headset, and damn, it gets the job done! As a first-timer, and never drove a car, the steering wheel feels very comfortable, with assignable buttons, and the force-feedback is pretty good. The pedals though, it feels toy-like. The clutch pedal feels too linear, the brake pedal has an artificial "load cell" in it that feels a bit strange when you press hard. Letting off quickly gives off a noisy plastic-clashing sound. There are a bunch of cables for this, so get ready for some cable management, or get a wheel stand and tie up the cables directly to the stand. Overall, it is very good.
customer_reviews.author: Jim H.

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what I wanted
customer_reviews.text: I spent literally years shopping for a racing wheel. I'm very picky and selective and didn't want anything less than full dual force feedback with pedals. This wheel and the pedals is simply awesome (unlike some Logitech devices like their wireless keyboards which are garbage). I highly recommend the G920. Note also that not only is the wheel powered, but the pedals are too! When braking around a tight corner, you'll feel the brake pedal shudder! (Forza 7). That shocked me, really really awesome.
customer_reviews.author: J. S. Harbour

customer_reviews.title: Really nice but not perfect.
customer_reviews.text: I have used it for at least 20hrs and the force feedback hasn’t worn out at all so the gears and everything is pretty good quality, it’s definitely a good setup for beginners, but I do have a few problems. Sometimes it clicks because that’s just the nature of the force feedback(check online reviews) so if you don’t have headphones on it gets extremely annoying. Also, I feel like the force feedback makes the steering extremely heavy, I had to turn it down to at least 40% just to make it feel realistic. I haven’t had to deal with a return or broken part but I have heard Logitech will exchange anything that simply doesn’t work.
customer_reviews.author: Sevda

customer_reviews.title: VR not as well supported
customer_reviews.text: The Logitech software doesn't automatically recognize VR versions of the same game. I had to create custom profiles for things. Also sometimes it wouldn't recognize the game even after I setup it up and I'd have to restart the game twice to get it to work. Other then software issues this steering wheel is insanely amazing to use in VR.
customer_reviews.author: J. Zimmerman

customer_reviews.title: Look into games. Amazing for truck sims
customer_reviews.text: Quality is alright although after a day of use my wheel has started to have a high pitch squeak when I turn to the left, I hope it'll go away or I'll have to return. Also I haven't found any game except euro truck sim, american truck sim and race 07 that works well with it. Understeer isnt a thing once car turns and try to counter it seems to do nothing but quickly switch and lauch the other way causing spinouts. I bought with idea to use in forza horizon 4 but no matter the settings seems impossible not to spin out especially offroad
customer_reviews.author: Nathan O

customer_reviews.title: Bought this to replace my old wheel, and love it so far
customer_reviews.text: I put a lot of miles (virtually) on my old Logitech wheel in different driving/race games, and eventually wore it out. The G29 is a step up when compared to my old wheel, and I'm enjoying it very much so far. The force feedback feels more realistic and solid than the previous wheel. The leather wrapped wheel feels great and the large paddle shifters are fantastic! The pedals are heavier and feel more like real car pedals than the ones I previously owned. Some users complain about the stiffness of the brake pedal, but I happen to like it. I haven't used the clutch pedal yet, as I don't own the G29 shifter.
customer_reviews.author: PlaneNuts

customer_reviews.title: 5 stars if it weren't for my grudge.
customer_reviews.text: I'll start by saying this product is perfect and as described. That said, I'm holding a grudge against Logitech for not coming up with a solution to the PS4 compatibility issue with the older Driving Force GT wheel. People have come up with complicated DIY hacks to make the old wheels function on PS4 (which is a little over my head) so it's obviously possible. So what I'm left with is two completely worthless Driving Force GT wheels. This new wheel is great, but offers nothing to me that the old one doesn't. I believe this to be a scam by Logitech to sell more units, and my only way to vent is to my fellow Amazoners.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Really happy with this wheel
customer_reviews.text: Really happy with this wheel. Based on all the people suggesting Thrustmaster wheels over this one I was a little concerned as to how much I was going to like it. After having this wheel a week now I can say that those concerns were completely unwarranted. This thing is an absolute blast on my PS4 with Project Cars, you really feel every little detail through the wheel, even when you go over curbing you can tell which side of the car went over it through the wheel. It's really transformed my racing experience, I don't even feel like I'm playing the same game anymore. I highly recommend this wheel.
customer_reviews.author: Cramlin

customer_reviews.title: Good wheel to start with
customer_reviews.text: Wheel is pretty good overall especially if you can get it within the $200s. Experienced some compatibility issues with PC but eventually it started working. There is one major design flaw which is the brake pedal. The spring and rubber used for the pedal's resistance is far too hard and requires too much force. This can be modified as shown on youtube but it voids your warranty. Another issue that I can't seem to solve that happens occasionally is throttle sometime cuts out when you have it all the way down. This has happened to me right before the finish line which is frustrating lol but overall I've had way more fun with this wheel than frustration. Would recommend
customer_reviews.author: Ahnaf Chowdhury

customer_reviews.title: Good driving controller for the price.
customer_reviews.text: Great addition to my xbox one s. The wires are ok for the length. Steering is sturdy enough but the quality of the plastic, specially the pedalboard one, it feels flimsy and definitely not ABS plastic. The hand shifter also doesn't feel quality enough, clicks sound very cheap and the metal is thin. Another thing I do not like personally is the pressure sensitivity of the brake pedal, it is VERY stiff to handle. I do own sports car and it's not like logitech says that you will be getting the real feel LOL... It's just another simulator in plastic. Just get a stand for this; with or without seating adjuster.
customer_reviews.author: Saad A.

customer_reviews.title: Great wheel and pedals
customer_reviews.text: Let me start by saying I have carpal tunnel in my wrists and had to return a Thrustmaster wheel because the force feedback was over the top and caused me pain not pleasure. The Logitech G920 has accurate feedback not insane pain causing feedback. It is truly a pleasure using this wheel and it does change racing games at a “core” level. I have played every Forza made with the regular controller but I am flabbergasted (yes it’s an underused word but truly accurate in this case) at the accuracies felt through this wheel in Forza 6 and 7. I haven’t yet tried the Horizon games but I am sure this wheel will not disappoint.
customer_reviews.author: Mrs. Wonderful

customer_reviews.title: It's "ok".
customer_reviews.text: Did a lot of sim racing back in the 90's, and getting back into it again. The G29 was recommended to me by a friend. I wish I'd spent a little more and gotten something better. There are a few degrees of dead zone in the middle of this wheel, when you are in that dead zone, you get zero feedback from the car. The clutch pedal doesn't work either. While this is probably fine for "games", it's not very good for a simulator like iRacing. My advice is to save your money and get something a little better that is belt driven.
customer_reviews.author: BReal

customer_reviews.title: Great addition to any racing fan... wish it lasted longer
customer_reviews.text: Loved these things right up until it broke 3 months after I purchased it. Everything works as it should and works well at first, the build quality seems great and the feel of playing your favorite driving games is amazing. I play a lot of F1 and this thing really makes it a whole new experience. The problem was the cord on the pedal assembly comes right out from the back, when I first set it up it got pinched against the wall, few months later that was the fail point. I was very sad to see it go after such a short life span. Sure loved it though
customer_reviews.author: Jeff pritchard

customer_reviews.title: Brake is Way too Hard to Press
customer_reviews.text: I was so excited to get this and the stand for it. When it came in, I used it for about 10 minutes and it's been in the closet with the winter coats and boots since. The only reason that I hate using it is the brake. You almost have to stand up out of your chair and STAND ON IT to get it to work. The brake tension is set about 5x higher than it should be. Until they fix that, this is a complete waste of money, unless of course, you play Nascar games, where you just step on the gas and turn left for five hours.
customer_reviews.author: Timbo

customer_reviews.title: Amp up your driving games
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for a few racing games on the PS4 and I am happy I did. I was surprised as to how much force feed back there is from this wheel. Racing or truck driving this wheel draws you into the game so much more. If you are not playing at a desk you will need to build or buy some sort of a stand for the wheel. Played on Snowrunner, mudrunner, drive club, project cars 2, nfs heat and dirt 2.0 it has a solid and comfortable feel to the wheel and pedals.
customer_reviews.author: Nettie

customer_reviews.title: Not a good expirience, great quality.
customer_reviews.text: So this wheel is hit or miss, it is a great product in terms of build quality but for me, the expirience leaves much to be desired. I think it's the best in the industry at it's price point. But that price point is very inflated. If it was 150 I would have given it a better rating. But 350 for this wheel is too high. There isn't enough feedback and the wheel is always too sensitive. You can tweak this, but at the end of the day it feels nothing like a real wheel.
customer_reviews.author: ashar

customer_reviews.title: Wont sit on a beveled edge desk.
customer_reviews.text: THIS IS ONLY A REVIEW OF THE SET UP...WILL MAYBE UPDATE WITH PRODUCT ONCE HE HAS USED IT. Ok so we just got this ike 2 hours ago and it has taken almost that long to set it up....due to having a beveled edge on my sons desk...unless you plan to cut a spot for the wheel to sit, have a long think if this is worth your sanity. Luckily my sons desk has a glass topper and we just pulled that forward to create a "flush " edge. We will no doubt either invest in a new desk or if i can be talked into, buying a race car thingy where he can sit in ala race driver.
customer_reviews.author: Adrian

customer_reviews.title: Feels great
customer_reviews.text: I have about 20 hours on this wheel, so not too much yet. It feels great and durable. The mechanism for resistance when turning feels good as well. All buttons and paddles feel like quality as well. There are comments about the brake sucking. Those people are very wrong. The brake is great, you just need to adjust settings in your game to get it to the feel you like. I had no issue with the brake once I spent 5 minutes tweaking the settings in Forza 7.
customer_reviews.author: SemiSecure

customer_reviews.title: great wheel but does it have to always spin when I am not using it ?
customer_reviews.text: Awesome for games we all agree. One quirk however. During the day once or twice the wheel decides to recalibrate itself for which it needs to spin all the way around a few times. No big deal when it's mounted, other than sometimes it does it night and wakes me up. But when I take it off the table when I need space for something else it can go haywire on the floor, start spinning around, knocking things off the table and pulling cables loose. I'm afraid it can decapitate my cat like a guillotine. Can this be addressed?
customer_reviews.author: Laura S.

customer_reviews.title: This is an amazing enhancement to your driving games
customer_reviews.text: You need to tune this, out of the box do not expect this to just work. It works fine but what I mean is that I spent days getting the settings just right for my individual games. As of right now this thing is all but spot on as for driving a real car on my pc. This seems like it will last a very long time and I hope it definitely does because I have a lot of fun with it. For relaxing games its fine with the clamps but for hardcore racing games, make sure you clamp this thing down tight, or else you might pull it off of your desk/table...
customer_reviews.author: David B.

customer_reviews.title: It works...but so did the cheaper ones
customer_reviews.text: This steering wheel works as described...but I have not seen anything that justifies the price tag on it! We had previously purchased a much cheaper version, and the only difference I can tell is the 'feel'. I'm thinking maybe we could have achieved the same with a steering wheel cover. Honestly the only reason I don't return it is because the husband enjoys it.. and so spend too much on household items to argue about his one time splurge.
customer_reviews.author: Kody Heskett

customer_reviews.title: Yesss!
customer_reviews.text: Love, love, love it!! The brake pedal is amazingly stiff, but I think the settings so I don't need to fully depress it. Works much better. The shifter is clearly "controller like", but very effective and feels pretty darn good. Love being able to race a stick shift again! The wheel itself, omg, is great. Leather wrapped, smells good, and feels even better when racing. Coming from a Driving Force GT, this thing is the bomb!
customer_reviews.author: R. P. Dingler

customer_reviews.title: Durable and perfectly tuned for Forza Horizon 4
customer_reviews.text: I use this logitec G920 wheel/pedals/shifter with an XBOX ONE S and a "AmazonBasics USB 3.0 Extension Cable - A-Male to A-Female Adapter Cord- 9.8 Feet (3.0 Meters) ". Using FH4 the game appears to be glitchy perhaps affected by latency that extension could produce. The D-pad seems to be the less responsible of all them. My shifter came with one of the clamp screws damaged due to poor factory assembly. I had to remove the nylon nut and re-screw the plastic retainer =>poor QC by Logitech.
customer_reviews.author: Jorge Urcaregui Placer

customer_reviews.title: Love this thing
customer_reviews.text: I bought this along with the shifter and it's very fun. The driver version I use in case anybody was wondering: LGS_9.02.65_x64 I had to use this driver because BeamNG.drive seems to make the steering wheel lock it self to the right(FFB). This driver fixed that and it works perfectly now.
customer_reviews.author: icantswimj

customer_reviews.title: Annoying squeak out of the box
customer_reviews.text: I love logitech products but the g29 and g920 they just cant seam to figure out how grease works its ridiculous super common problem the wheel squeaks when turning left. People have said they exchanged it under warranty and the new one did the exact same thing but if you take it apart to add grease it voids the warranty so be warned. I just got it 2/27/19. 4 years after it came out you would think they would get their act together but be weary I love the feel of the wheel and the price is great but the headache isn't worth it. Go thrust master if you want quality!
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Xbox drivers, you need this
customer_reviews.text: Got this for playing Formula 1 2019 and Dirt4. How people manage with just an Xbox controller is beyond me! This is the only way to go! Payed way over market, but was the only one available, thanks to Covid19 and I was bored! Not regretting it.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good if you have a racing stand
customer_reviews.text: It checks all the boxes for features but I'm scratching my head trying to figure out why Logitech would make the brake pedal so stiff. Yeah, I know I can open it up and fix it but that's not the point. If you don't have a stand the pedals are useless.
customer_reviews.author: Scott in Moultrie

customer_reviews.title: Great beginner wheel!
customer_reviews.text: For as long as I could remember I had wanted to be a professional Rally Racer. Unfortunately, that requires a lot of money, so I settled for Rally simulation. I did a fair amount of research and while I am aware that there may be objectively better wheels at this price point, the consensus seemed to be that this was the best wheel for an entry-level sim racer, and I couldn't agree more, I don't regret purchasing this wheel at all, and would recommend it to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: Aaron Flamisch

customer_reviews.title: Good steering wheel but not truely compatible with all pc games.
customer_reviews.text: When it says compatible for ps4 and pc. It's more compatible towards the ps4. As for pc I could only get truck simulator to work with the steering wheel. All other racing or simulator games I tried it told me my steering wasn't compatible due to xbox and pc uses the same button layouts and not the ps4 layouts. So if you want to buy this for pc. I would highly recommend getting the xbox pc version. Unfortunately I made the wrong choice and now I have to buy another steering wheel for my pc. Luckily I still use the ps4 so I will be keeping this wheel. Other than that it's a good beginners wheel for the price.
customer_reviews.author: jason gage

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic from arcade to realism driving!
customer_reviews.text: Very responsive and awesome product. Once you fully configure it, you will have the most tailored driving experience. I added the shifter with it and it is terrific. Force Feedback: pretty brutal at the beginning, once you are use to it and you smoother your driving style you will feel every single movement of the car. On the wheel controls: just a Xbox one controller so well placed and easy to use. Shifting paddles: nice to catch on straight lines you will be challenged during corners. Pedals: gas great, clutch easy, brake a little bit hard but I like it. USB cable: I would enjoy 1 or 2 extra feet...
customer_reviews.author: Anthony C.

customer_reviews.title: awful. Don't touch this product
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my PS4 pro. It is delivered without any technical instructions and it simply will not communicate with my PS4. As for the "Online Help" facility at Logitech, it does not exist. Terrible product. I've been looking online for any solutions and it is obvious that there are many people who have experienced exactly the same problems I have.
customer_reviews.author: Timothy Victor

customer_reviews.title: Well worth it if you want good quality + not too expensive
customer_reviews.text: Honestly for the price I couldn’t think about anything else. Got it for $200, while it’s a bit steep, I’ll be using it for awhile. Force feedback is sturdy, leather wrapping is nice, responsive wheel, and also easy to put on. Definitely worth it if you’re hesitant to buy this. Shifter comes separately, bought it also and I am satisfied.
customer_reviews.author: William

customer_reviews.title: Great wheel for beginner sim racing
customer_reviews.text: Once you get the wheel dialed in and figured out it's an amazing experience if you have a good setup. You need to download the logitech driver and software to access the operating degree ranges for the wheel. Windows drivers won't access that, I would highly recommend using the Logitech software for the wheel anyways. I use this wheel for DiRT Rally series & Assetto Corsa, works great. If you're a newbie like me to the wheel I strongly recommend reading up and learning about your new G29 since there are a lot of adjustments that can make your experience great leaving a big grin on your face.
customer_reviews.author: Slate

customer_reviews.title: Must have
customer_reviews.text: These wheel is awesome. You play driving simulator games like forza etc. then this is your setup. Only one thing too know. You really, really have to fine tune the wheel to your style, feel and the game. Right out of the box the force feed back is way to high. It will rip the wheel out of your hand. But once dialed in its awesome. As close to driving the the car as you can get in real life.
customer_reviews.author: SSG Daley

customer_reviews.title: Gilded garbage
customer_reviews.text: I don’t have enough time to go over all the Problems have with this product and I’ve only had it a mere few days. The wheel’s exterior material flaunts fancy leather but is, in words: gilded, a dipped gold, not gold, just pretending. The plastic is like that of a Walmart shopping cart. It took far too long to set up and has already broken 5 times and I’ve had to spend hours fixing it. Now the pedals (namely the clutch) have just stopped responding all together. I’ve read everything on this page amongst other forums and videos to solve these problems an nothing has worked.
customer_reviews.author: Tate

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely Fantastic Quality - Lots of fun for all driving games, XBOX or PC or even ARCADE!
customer_reviews.text: When you combine this wheel w/ a racing stand, your whole experience changes; however, on its own it's still an absolutely a fantastic buy. I've spend hours already on this, and not just w/ racing games across xbox or pc, but even my raspberry pi retro pie arcade - playing the old formula one games. This buy is an investment, but it's a fantastic investment. Metal brush, sturdy, leather - i love it - absolutely love it.
customer_reviews.author: C. Bartholomew

customer_reviews.title: Not compatible with a lot of games
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my husband because he has a ton of racing games, but it only works for 1 of them. It came with a list of games it’s compatible with, and there was only 10 games listed. We had to go out and buy another $60 game just so he could have more than one game he could use this with. He said the wheel is very jerky when he uses it.
customer_reviews.author: KrystalO

customer_reviews.title: Changes the game...
customer_reviews.text: I use this for Project Cars 2 on PC and Gran Turismo Sport on the PS4. So far I really like it. I did not want to spend thousands on a direct drive setup with custom wheels and pedals, so this fit the bill nicely. A little bit noisy when it clips and grinds...but that can be corrected via settings and custom profiles if annoying. Force feedback is strong and works great. Build quality is there. It even has a new car smell when opening the box. Very pleased for $200.
customer_reviews.author: TheHunterGT

customer_reviews.title: Great quality, realistic, works great with PC and Xbox
customer_reviews.text: I love this thing to bits and it’s only been a month. I use this wheel on American truck simulator, Euro Truck Simulator 2, Forza horizon 4, and other assortments of racing and driving games. The response in the wheel makes it feel like you’re sitting high in the cab of a Kenworth W900, or whizzing by in a formula 1 race car. It has very good, high quality leather wrapped around it which adds to realism and gives it a nice grip to hold onto. It works well with both PC and Xbox, and I advise buying the shifter with it because it works great with the shifter.
customer_reviews.author: AJ Smith

customer_reviews.title: Great Wheel. Poor Brake Pedal
customer_reviews.text: The wheel itself is well made, high quality materials. But unfortunately, mine came with a stiff brake pedal, which resulted in a poor racing experience. I tried tweaking the settings for each game, but the pedal would not work as intended, to the point that I had to make the hard decision to return the wheel. It's too bad, I was looking forward to migrate from a game pad to a more realistic experience.
customer_reviews.author: Freakonforfatty

customer_reviews.title: First time wheel buyer here :)
customer_reviews.text: I bought this mostly for casual/free roam FH4 and FM7 on xbox. Works great! fresh out the box plug and play. May have to search dampening settings for the games you want to play and fine tune it from there. I've driven a manual transmission in real life and this basically taught me somewhat properly without having to buy a car haha. --welded up a HAGGARD rig for it lmao. pics up eventually-- pretty cool stuff. :D
customer_reviews.author: Odinox

customer_reviews.title: I feel I got more than I've pay!
customer_reviews.text: For me this is the best steering wheel for beginners, this bring rpm led indicator what is awesome and there is not another wheel of this price with that feature, also the steering wheel is cover with leather that make it look nice, Pedals: the brake pedals bring a load cell that help you to regulate the brake pressure and this pedals are really better than the thrustmaster 150 pro bring with it... In my opinion this steering wheel could be more expensive than thrustmaster t150 pro and it is even cheaper!
customer_reviews.author: Stanislao

customer_reviews.title: Excellent feedback on Gran Turismo
customer_reviews.text: I bought this wheel along with a driving seat so that I could access Gran Turismo on the PS4. The setup was easy and the wheel mounts well with the driving seat. The look and feel of the wheel and pedals is first rate. The feedback through the hands is excellent and the pedals feel very realistic. I highly recommend this product for anyone that wants to get the most out of their seat time practice using the GT platform
customer_reviews.author: BG

customer_reviews.title: Worked great until it didn’t - 2 months in
customer_reviews.text: Worked great until it didn’t. I’m 2 months into this purchase and after a few F1 2018 grand prix there is a rattle inside the wheel and no buttons are working. Wheel was very much babied but it appears to be a poor design. The force feedback causes the wheel to shake violently and I don’t believe the design and manufacturing is high quality. Trying to start a warranty claim with Logitech and the their warranty site times out on me. Will continue to push and see if I can get it completed. Overall very dissatisfied with this purchase. May be worth spending the extra money and going for a more expensive but higher quality wheel.
customer_reviews.author: Ne0n1c

customer_reviews.title: Decent first wheel. Minor issues with squeaking sound & brake pedal
customer_reviews.text: The wheel is amazing like really amazing its my first wheel and I love pretty much everything about it but I do hope that the squeaking sound goes really soon and also I hope I wear out the brake pedal since it has the rubber piece in it and you can barely push it down it really messes me up when I play ATS or ETS2 other than those two everything else is pretty great. Also with the squeaking sound when turning left I looked for troubleshooting options on Youtube and its quite a frequent problem amongst the owners of the wheel hopefully it just goes in time.
customer_reviews.author: Sean Scubb

customer_reviews.title: Great for both PS3 & PS4
customer_reviews.text: This is the best video gaming steering wheel I’ve ever had (I’ve had 6 or 7)! The Force feedback is very realistic and I’m still amazed at the correct feel of the brake pedal. One thing that took me quite a while to find is the very small PS3/PS4 switch on the top of the unit. I highly recommend this!
customer_reviews.author: Kathy King

customer_reviews.title: Great fun and great support
customer_reviews.text: I love the system but it began having some quirks so I contacted tech support and, although responses were a bit slow due to current issues, they stayed with it and resolved the issue better than I expected.
customer_reviews.author: Ken S

customer_reviews.title: Immerse yourself in driving without a controller.
customer_reviews.text: Ok I love racing games but playing such rich detailed lovingly recreated maps like the ones in the modern games lends more to immersion than a Xbox 1 controller. Enter the Logitech G92 Dual Actiom racing wheel. Whoa it was actually like playing an old cabinet game. The wheel is wrapped in leather and comfortable until you know you spin out and hit the wall then the wheel feeds right on back. Love this wheel. It’s responsive and light I got a stand for it and now I’m in it. Did it improve my skill gosh no ha ha haaa. It did add a large increase in immersion.
customer_reviews.author: Chauncey Pope

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY THIS!!!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: If you are a X-Box user DO NOT BUY THIS PRODUCT. I've been trying to connect my wheel to my X-Box for a month. When logging onto Logitech's customer service THE FIRST THING SAYS : WE'VE HAD NUMEROUS REPORTS OF THE GAME NOT RECOGNIZING A RACING WHEEL!!!!!!! SO WHY ARE YOU STILL SELLING IT AT THIS POINT!!!!!! They gave 2 options on how to resolve the issue, which of course I tried with ZERO success. SHAME ON YOU LOGITECH for selling a product that, according to you does not work yet!!!!!!!!!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Laurie Monastra

customer_reviews.title: Great for the older Forza race games, not the newest one
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my husband for Christmas to play with the latest Forza game and he quickly discovered that it doesn't work great with that one. But what started out as disappointment turned into excitement when he realized that it is great for a couple of his older Forza games that are more of the track racing style! He had given up on those games because they were too difficult to play with the controller, but with this he can now enjoy them again.
customer_reviews.author: PDX Ford GalTop Contributor: Coloring

customer_reviews.title: The Squeakmaker
customer_reviews.text: This thing squeaks when you turn the wheel. Sometimes it's really bad, sometimes it's barely noticeable, but it's always squeaking. Other than that, it's solid and it works and there's plenty of buttons to configure. I did have to get in touch with tech support as some of the buttons weren't working originally, but they helped and it is now working.
customer_reviews.author: asdfate

customer_reviews.title: Poor Electronics
customer_reviews.text: I had 5 of them and could not get any of them to work correctly. I had to send all 5 of them back to Logitech. service wasn't that great from Logitech on top of it all. they were very hard to get a hold of, always in meetings and so on ( this is the tear 2 operation ) which should be a little more important to your needs. Most of my Logitech electronics work good but not this one, I will need to buy a wheel from somewhere else. Mark
customer_reviews.author: Nthstar

customer_reviews.title: Racing is fun again
customer_reviews.text: The only thing I don't like is no one makes a wheel anymore where the paddles can double as gas and brake. Other than that they finally made a wheel where the pedals actually go 100 percent. Previous wheels would make me the slowest on the track. This is my first shifter. It really adds to the fun of driving. With the nice stand, an Xbox one s and x, I feel like I'm in the car.
customer_reviews.author: Curtis H.

customer_reviews.title: Amazing starting wheel with great features.
customer_reviews.text: This is a great starting racing wheel for PS4 and PC. The feel and quality are great and the features are awesome too. I love the setup and easy to use with the PS4 and PC/Mac. The only complaint I have is that the cable management to only draw the cables from the bottom is lacking some flexibility but its the ONLY thing so far.
customer_reviews.author: CNK002

customer_reviews.title: not a FAN
customer_reviews.text: Force feedback is so inconsistent. Between 11 oclock and 1 oclock there is almost no feedback at all. And then between 1 and 2 and 10 and 11 it sort of kicks in and out. I used exclusively with the latest NASCAR Heat (4 I think). And messed with all the steering settings, googled other peoples settings etc. Better than using a controller to be sure, but totally unimpressed.
customer_reviews.author: CSG

customer_reviews.title: Great for Dad
customer_reviews.text: This was for my dad. He’s been into racing games and some game where he’s a truck driver. He was all excited to show me how realistic it is. I’m not into games, but it was impressive. He got a big curved screen and it looked very real. He turned the wheel and backed his big rig in to pickup his load - it seemed seamless and smooth just like he was doing it in real life. He absolutely loves it.
customer_reviews.author: Nguyen-ing

customer_reviews.title: This was such a let down
customer_reviews.text: I had built this up so much in my head and was just disappointed when it came in. The clamps wouldn't expand enough to attach it to my computer desk so I had to use it on a TV tray in the living room with my Xbox. The USB cable is short for a device like this in today's world if large TV's. When I attached a USB extension it wouldn't power up, tried another with the same results. When I did get it working it was a good experience. But the shortcomings bring this down A LOT. I ended up returning it.
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: Good value
customer_reviews.text: It's a good wheel overall, and will plug and play with most ps3/4 racing games like gran Turismo. Compared to a PlayStation controller I was faster and more accurate with the wheel after ~4 hours of gameplay with the g29 and after a month of use I'm about 10-25% faster with the wheel depending on the game! One note is that for dirt/off road games I highly recommend buying or creating a study rig and looking up input settings
customer_reviews.author: Stevin Sturtz

customer_reviews.title: Terrible.
customer_reviews.text: Countersteered in gt sport and heard a nasty grind noise from the steering motor within 5 minutes into the game and 45 minutes after opening the box. Accompanying shifter was not registering the correct gears. 5th gear was hit or miss. Pedals slid on the carpet very easily. Steering wheel ossillated badly just on a straight away. Shifter and wheel does not hold well to table. The ancient arcade game, cruising usa, had a better shifter than this junk did.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: More realistic driving feel.
customer_reviews.text: This wheel is a nice way to have a more immersive feel while driving. If you enjoy racing or trucking sims this is a lot of fun. Driving over bumps and going around curves you feel the wheel pushing and pulling you. For a home gaming rig this really isn't a bad investment. I was lucky to have been able to try a G27 version which is basically the same as this. You can adjust the way the wheel reacts within the games so if the wheel reacts too much or too little you can adjust to your needs. Try it.
customer_reviews.author: Kristopher John

customer_reviews.title: Best wheel/pedals for money, modify them later
customer_reviews.text: Pros: cheap, durable, feedback on steering wheel is pretty good, pedals feel somewhat realistic, easy to modify to your specifications Cons: wheel table mount only works on thin table tops, the rubber block in the brake pedal makes it horrible to use until it is removed, floor mounted pedals (easy to fix) Overall for the price it can’t be beat but expect to play around with the set until you find a solution that you enjoy.
customer_reviews.author: Stan B.

customer_reviews.title: Sent it back
customer_reviews.text: Product would not connect to my Xbox one S. Does not mount on my desk because the front is to thick. Need better mounting system, or at least more versatile. I went with a thrustmaster instead and it seems to work much better. Product just blinks and does not connect.
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan Mullinax

customer_reviews.title: Mounting brackets didn't fit my table, Great wheel nonetheless
customer_reviews.text: This is a great wheel. Perfect for your beginner or average person into racing games. The only problem I have with this wheel is NOT actually with the wheel. it needs a proper place to be mounted. None of the tables around my home were the right height or thickness Etc. Just be aware. Other than that I love this thing and recommend it
customer_reviews.author: Steelo47

customer_reviews.title: Good wheel for the money
customer_reviews.text: It's a good wheel. Plug and play; combined with Oculus VR it makes for a pretty immersive experience. Sure, you can feel/hear the helical gears. So what? It may be old tech but it's reliable (looking at you T150 that burned up in 3 hours). The T3PA pedals have a better feel to them, but this setup is good enough for the casual sim racer like myself.
customer_reviews.author: ADAM A BORCHARDT

customer_reviews.title: Buy this not the cheap one
customer_reviews.text: Good wheel. I'm not that well versed but i did own a cheaper Ferrari wheel that was like 60 bucks, only turned 180 degrees and was overall terrible. This product was such a big step up i cant even explain. The price might be a little scary for a beginner but i definitely recommend saving up for this thing over wasting cash on a cheaper awful alternative .
customer_reviews.author: Nikki

customer_reviews.title: Fun! Realistic driving experience!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my 12yo grandson to play Forza 4 on XBox One. Seems to be sturdy and versatile. It came with the pedals and I also purchased the gear shift. Seems to be sturdy. It did NOT come with hardware to attach it to anything. I also purchased a stand. If not for son’s tool box, I would have had to take it to the hardware store for suitable screws. Non of the 3 components came with screws! Odd. I searched the boxes several times and my son asked too where the screws were.
customer_reviews.author: Gail G

customer_reviews.title: Realism at its finest
customer_reviews.text: Any serious racing game fan MUST buy this.It take racing games to a new level.The force feed back is fantastic and increases the fun factor.It's a bit pricey,but you get what you pay for.If you love racing games,start saving your pennies because you won't regret it. Edit:I gave the beginner rating 3 stars because it takes a bit of doing to calibrate the wheel.There are many videos online to help you through it.
customer_reviews.author: Crazyeddie

customer_reviews.title: The adjustments are key for the best experience
customer_reviews.text: The pedals overall were okay but the brake pedal wasn't tolerable, too stiff and unrealistic, found a video on YouTube that you can remove a little rubber piece inside it and it was a lot better. The wheel, on the other hand, is a little too small. I had to make a few adjustments in the game to get it somewhat where I felt comfortable, I kept spinning around in the game but I guess it takes time to get used to.
customer_reviews.author: Adli A.

product_meta.title: Logitech Dual-Motor Feedback Driving Force G29 Gaming Racing Wheel with Responsive Pedals for PlayStation 4 and PlayStation 3 - Black
product_meta.description: Platform For Display:PC + PS4 Compatible| Configuration:Wheel/Pedals OnlyThe definitive sim racing wheel for PlayStation 4 and PlayStation 3. Driving Force is designed for the latest racing game titles for your PlayStation 4 or PlayStation 3 console. Add Driving Force to your controller selection and you may never want to race with a regular controller again. With dual motor force feedback, on wheel controls and responsive pedals, G29 makes racing feel like the real deal.
feature_bullets: The definitive sim racing wheel for PlayStation 4 and PlayStation 3: Realistic steering and pedal action for the latest racing titles
Built to last: Durable solid steel ball bearings, stainless steel shifter and pedals and hand stitched leather wheel grip
Dual motor force feedback: Realistically simulates the racing experience with smooth, quiet helical gearing
Easy access game controls: On wheel D pad, console buttons, paddle shifters and LED indicator lights
Responsive floor pedal unit: Accelerate, brake and change gears with the feel of an actual car. Pedal piston sleeves: Polyoxymethylene thermoplastic (POM)
G29 requirements: PlayStation 4 or 3, Powered USB port or Windows 10, 8.1, Windows 8 or Windows 7, mac OS 10.10+

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.6 out of 5 stars6,038 ratings4.6 out of 5 stars
